page.title: 20PUBLIC FOOTPATHS IN PARKGATE
page.content: The area round{Parkgate}is well off for footpaths. There are so many rights of way that it is possible to walk from each of the main villages in the area,{Heswall,Neston}and{Thornton {Hough}by means of a public footpath only, apart from crossing a main road. Since the area is densely populated the rights of way are well used. They are kept in reasonable condition by the farmers and are well sign-posted. One of the best is the {Wirral Way. This was a railway until{l965.}It was abandoned but was then made into a footpath running from{West Kirby}to {Hooton Station.}This is also a{Country {Park}with a ranger service to keep visitors well informed about the local history and wildlife, with lectures and guided walks. It is also popular with{horse riders}as there is a well made bridleway running alongside it.
